title: Finish frontend event-feed migration to canonical loop namespaces
description: Complete client event key selection/rendering migration so tick/build/train/scout/hostile canonical keys render deterministically with compatibility alias fallback and no default alias selection.
acceptance_criteria: Client resolves canonical loop namespace keys for tick/build/train/scout/hostile outcomes in default first-session rendering
Legacy key aliases resolve through deterministic compatibility mapping without overriding canonical defaults
Golden-path first-slice actions no longer emit missing-template fallback markers for loop-event keys

title: Extend backend contract drift validator to enforce canonical loop-event coverage
description: Build on the hostile token drift validator to enforce canonical/alias constraints across loop namespace keys (tick/build/train/scout/hostile) and emit key-level mismatch diagnostics.
acceptance_criteria: Validator fails when canonical loop namespace keys required for first-slice tick/build/train/scout/hostile coverage are missing from manifest or seed rows
Validator fails when compatibility alias keys are selected as canonical defaults in loop namespace mappings
Failure output reports per-key and per-token mismatch details to enable one-pass correction

title: Requeue platform wrapper lane sweep for Steam and Android command reproducibility
description: Deliver a clean implementation pass that supersedes prior blocked wrapper artifacts by proving deterministic Steam Tauri and Android Capacitor wrapper prepare/dev/package command lanes with placeholder-only metadata.
acceptance_criteria: Steam and Android wrapper scripts expose deterministic prepare/dev/package command paths with documented prerequisites and outputs
Platform placeholder metadata/assets manifest is present for both wrappers and explicitly marked replaceable
Release-gate documentation references the canonical wrapper commands used by platform stage validation

title: Run release-blocking slice gate with loop-key drift and wrapper evidence
description: Execute the first-slice release gate after loop-key migration and wrapper sweep, then publish PASS/FAIL evidence with owner-tagged blockers for any failing critical stage.
acceptance_criteria: Gate evidence records PASS/FAIL for playable, scope, quality, platform, and release-readiness stages after the new tranche changes
Any failing critical stage includes a concrete owner-tagged blocker summary with the exact failing command or check
No additional non-critical QA-only follow-up tasks are created unless a release-blocking failure is present

title: Enforce canonical-default preference in event feed key resolver
description: Update the event key resolution path to consume `migration_key_status` semantics so default rendering uses only canonical-default keys and compatibility-only aliases are accepted only as fallback lookup inputs.
acceptance_criteria: Direct default rendering selection ignores all keys tagged compatibility-only
Alias payloads resolve deterministically to their canonical-default key for rendering
Resolver tests cover at least one alias case in each flow: tick, build, train, scout, hostile_dispatch_and_resolve

title: Add full loop token-contract parity test for first-slice narrative matrix
description: Extend seed contract coverage so tick/build/train/scout canonical token lists are validated against the first-slice matrix contract with the same strictness currently used for hostile keys.
acceptance_criteria: Tick/build/train/scout canonical keys are asserted against expected required token arrays in automated tests
Compatibility alias keys remain present and explicitly excluded from default canonical selection checks
Test fails deterministically on canonical token drift for any first-slice loop key
